oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Registers, lists, etc.; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America -- Army -- Subsistence Bureau; Confederate States of America -- Army -- Supplies and stores; Confederate States of America -- War Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Document lists prices to be paid by Confederate armies when buying or impressing goods such as wheat, flour, corn, bacon, beef, sugar, candles, soap, and many others. It includes the 5-year average for prices of goods preceding the war, the percentage of price increase, and the price fixed by the Secretary of War after the percentage increase. Some items such as salt had increased 900%; coffee increased 733.3%.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- War Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Prices were fixed by the Confederate Secretary of War and could include a fee for transport. Prices were set as "maximums" to prevent profiteering. No year is indicated in this document, only the month (May), but it is a matter of record that the Confederacy began to suffer from the lack of food and supplies long before the end of the war.
